main.name: John Lei
main.description: studying Management Information Systems with a minor in Computer Science
main.bio: I am presently studying Management Information Systems at Boston University with an expected graduation date of May 2022. My major coursework has also cultivated an interest in Computer Science, which I am currently pursuing a minor in as well. I am particularly interested in how information technology is increasingly more vital in the creation of social good and opportunities for all individuals. I enjoy challenging myself by taking on a rigorous academic courseload each semester. My main interests outside of work include exploring the world where I can learn all about cultures outside of my comfort zone.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: B.S.BA concentration Management Information Systems and Minor Computer Science
education.description: Relevant Coursework: Cross Functional Core, Macroeconomics, Calculus 2, Business Society and Ethics, Chinese Philosophy, Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Introduction to Finance, Introduction to Information Systems, Introduction to Computer Science 1 (Python), Introduction to Computer Science 2 (Java), Management Communications, Dynamics of Leading Organizations, Probability and Statistics 1, Probability and Statistics 2, Financial Management, Marketing Management,  Operations Management, Business Analytics, Combinatoric Structures, The Material World, Youth in the Middle East, Studio 1, Studio 2, Interdisciplinary Perspectives on Global Challenges 1 and 2 .

work.title: Telephone Operator
work.description: Enhanced Alumni-University engagement through informative phone calls updating Boston University Alumni of current events and activities. Engaged with Alumni through one-on one phone calls to raise funds for University endeavors

work.title: Processing Logistics
work.description: Managed storage logistics of 50+ crates of fish on a daily basis. Worked 16hr shifts, 7 days a week to ensure smooth work flow in the processing of incoming fish to the factory. Identified hazards in the workplace and followed the emergency action plans to ensure safety

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
